other_tests.findings: The gallbladder wall is markedly edematous with multiple gallstones. No biliary duct dilatation. The common bile duct measures 5 mm; no stones within the common duct. No focal liver lesions seen. A focal area of low-signal intensity in the fissure for the falciform ligament consistent with perfusional change. The main portal vein and hepatic veins are patent. No free fluid or upper abdominal lymphadenopathy. Unremarkable spleen, kidneys, adrenal glands, and pancreas.
